body: Do you guys need any additional data from me or do you know already know what's happening from the panic log I posted?
I think we do know whats happening from the logs, just need someone to find time to fix it

Actually not really. I tried my best to figure out the root cause by staring at the backtrace and going through the code for a good 30 minutes or so while I was on a plane the other day, without being able to see the deadlock.

Instead I started refactoring out a bunch of the locking from the model code, which will in the end probably solve this anyway. But if you do figure out the root cause, let us know :)

Actually, yeah it's not clear where it's being held.

Can you run with all the previous env vars you ran but also add STTRACE=sync, and once it panics get the tracebacks + logs.

It look like I have a similar issue on Centos6.

[log.txt](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/files/533099/log.txt)
Thats the wrong process and it does not contain the relevant logs I asked for.

I tried, couldn't find  the issue page which described how to get the infos again, also forum isn't loading for me for some reason (so I can't look into the thread where the issue is linked...).
Edit: it locked again.

Since the forum was back and i could check out the instructions,  I used STDEADLOCKTIMEOUT=300 and got a bunch of panic logs and STTRACE=sync was also set. Here are the panic logs.
Hopefully, reducing the deadlock timeout to 5 minutes instead of 10 didn't break anything.
[syncthing-panic.tar.gz](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/files/533468/syncthing-panic.tar.gz)

Can you download al build from

https://build.syncthing.net/job/syncthing/2297/
or
https://build.syncthing.net/job/syncthing-mac/540/

and do exactly what you did before?
It should have more details in the panic message this time.

issue.title: Web ui not loading and not updating

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
What happened:
Was setting up syncthing on a new computer, when I noticed all the other's gui were at first not loading at all, and after a restart of the services, only showing 'unknown' on all folders (they were mostly synced already), as well as most of the time not loading at all if I tried to refresh the page.

What you expected to happen: 
Web gui showing the status of syncing.

Steps done:
- Setup syncthing on 3 computers for a large data set (> 1.5 TB)
- Let it sync for one night
- Notice all the non-fonctional uis in the morning.

These screenshot were taken after restarting the services (after all the uis stopped loading) on the morning. Uptime isn't updating either. All folder show 0 items, 0 bytes.
![screenshot_20161014_115310](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3176238/19383555/4044ae34-9205-11e6-957a-4302f73f297f.png)
![screenshot_20161014_115328](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3176238/19383553/4043346e-9205-11e6-8f5e-18dcee8aed67.png)
![screenshot_20161014_115454](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3176238/19383554/40447cb6-9205-11e6-9768-fd479290f4bc.png)
### Version Information

Syncthing Version: v0.14.8
OS Version: Windows server 2008 r2 / Centos 6.8
Browser Version: Chromium 53.0.2785.143 (64-bit)

issue.title: ARMv5 (GoFlex Home) "Unknown" Folder Status, No Sync

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
I successfully installed syncthing on my GoFlex Home (Arch) and Windows 10 desktop. The Windows machine has finished indexing several folders with lots of data and files, and I was able to share the folders with the GFH just fine. However, no sync is taking place, and the folders report an "unknown" status. I've tried changing the rescan interval and manually rescanning the folders. Permissions appear to be correct on the GFH. 

The GFH is not a powerful machine, however the RAM and CPU usage don't seem to indicate that hardware specs are the issue with this...

I expected the GFH to begin to sync the files from each folder listed on the Windows machine. Screenshots are below, GFH first, then Windows.
### Version Information

Syncthing Version: v0.14.9, Linux (ARM)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14971927/19628009/6264563a-9909-11e6-8d63-52ae59c7d726.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14971927/19628017/7ad857fc-9909-11e6-8bc4-51d967629d42.png)

body: I'm also affected on multiple linux devices on arm and x64 platforms. the build links above are broken. please let me know if I can provide any useful info.

Please try https://build.syncthing.net/job/syncthing/2335/
with `STTRACE=sync STDEADLOCKTIMEOUT=300` env vars and provide logs once it panics.
